Full Job Description
What you will be doing

Contribute in developing database structures for OLTP systems in multiple backend types.
Contribute to implement ETL and ELT process to consolidate data across multiple systems
Develop APIs, services, data transfers to internal and external systems
Resolve performance and security issues relating to data access and maintenance
Understand and contribute to a corporate data model and overall data governance
Follow best practices for a full software development lifecycle involving data and code.
Perform unit testing of database and service API
Contribute to new technology evaluations and recommended usage by developing proof of concepts in java or aws services to use in upcoming projects
Provide support for database related issues affecting system or process availability.

What You Need for this Position

Rising Seniors Graduating in December 2021 or May 2022
Pursuing a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, CIS or related field
Basic knowledge/experience of Java, AWS and Backend Types like postgres, Oracle, SQL Server and NoSQL DB would be a plus
Basic understanding of ETL process and data warehouse concepts
Good Communication skills.

Key Skills & Competencies

Superior Interpersonal Skills: Ability to interface with a wide range of personalities and levels within Cvent and client organizations; Professional communication style
Data Collection and Analysis: Proactive listening; resourceful in collecting sufficient data; Analysis of data to develop and implement best solution
Initiative: Tenacity in problem solving with positive outcomes; Motivated to increase capacity and responsibility

At Cvent we celebrate, support and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristics.

Cvent Maintains a drug-free workplace.

Full Job Description
We are seeking a motivated college student with interest in joining our growing organization for a 10-week summer internship program. Conning’s comprehensive program features hands-on activities and daily interaction with our information security and IT infrastructure teams to perform information security daily, weekly and monthly functions. The candidate will be trained on security tools/processes and work on a wide variety of security tasks including vulnerability management, cybersecurity event monitoring, asset management, and product research.

The program also offers valuable training and development for young professionals, meaningful mentoring relationships, and community service participation. The intern will lead a strategic project presented to company leadership at the end of the program.

Duties and Responsibilities May Include:
Work directly with information security staff to ensure newly discovered vulnerabilities are collaborated with the remediation team in a timely manner
Review security tools, logs, and other systems as assigned
Monitor cybersecurity events/alerts platform
Assist with investigation, critical issue, and documentation of cybersecurity events
Assist with information security initiatives.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date security documentation
Maintain flexibility to work autonomously and in teams on variety of duties as assigned

Requirements:
Pursuing Bachelor’s degree in Information Security, Computer Science, or a related field.
Undergraduate students going into their Junior or Senior year ONLY
Must have local accommodation
Knowledge of information security concepts
Knowledge of networking concepts including TCP/IP, hardware, routers, switches, firewalls, IDS/IPS systems
Knowledge of Windows workstation and server operating systems
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite
Attention to detail and strong analytic skills

Conning is an equal opportunity employer. Our company embraces the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion; our employees can bring the best version of themselves to work every day. We thrive in an environment where everyone’s voice is heard, every idea counts, and the differences of our employees are valued. We provide reasonable accommodations to those who need them.

If you are unable to complete this application due to a disability, contact us to ask for an accommodation or an alternative application process.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Full Job Description
About Our Internship Program:
Here at Amway, our interns develop through real world experience and are assigned meaningful projects that challenge and allow for personal growth. All Interns receive project support and on-going performance feedback from a person advisor and hiring manager. Amway hosts over 80+ interns each summer and offers programming events designed to assist navigating Amway culture, making the most of a summer internship, and building a successful career. The program provides exposure to a breadth of career fields and offers unique opportunities to learn business acumen, work cross-functionally and showcase their skillsets directly to hiring managers and executives.

Internship Eligibility:
This job posting is for our summer 2021 Internship Program (May – August); qualified candidates must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and one semester or more left of school to complete at the beginning of their internship. Candidates who have graduated are not eligible to intern.

** Please note, these positions are not eligible for Sponsorship.

Internship Job Title: IT – Software Developer (CRM)

What is special about this team: The Marketing Automation team is a software product team within the Amway IT organization which is responsible for transforming Amway’s capabilities for Customer Relationship Management (CRM). We work closely with the Marketing and Digital teams at Amway to deliver platforms and solutions which help us engage with our ABOs and customers with relevant, personalized messaging. The team works on cutting-edge cloud technologies with many opportunities to learn new skills and solve exciting problems.

How would an intern contribute to the team’s success? Candidates will get involved in the full-stack deployment of a new technology platform at Amway to expand our Marketing Automation capabilities. The team will be responsible to develop, deploy and support all aspects of the platform, which will be built on a modern cloud architecture. The initiative will follow an Agile/Scrum delivery model and will own the full lifecycle of the solution set following DevOps practices. Candidates will be given the tools and training required for the role, along with coaching and mentorship opportunities.

An example of a typical project is: Candidates will directly support the development and deployment of the Marketing Automation platform. You will apply your expertise to building the core platform along with the supporting technology components - event streams, REST APIs, messaging channel connectors, analytical data, log streams and more. You will have opportunity to work independently as well as in a team context to deliver features and functionality for our Marketing team.

What skills and background will be important to be successful in this internship:

Desired Skills: Experience or coursework involving programming/software development – JavaScript, TypeScript, Java or Python preferred. Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Familiarity with software integration patterns, DevOps tools and practices, or CRM software products is beneficial. A positive outlook, growth mindset, and desire to deliver solutions which will benefit Amway’s distributors and customers.

Desired Degree: Pursuing Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent

Location of Internship: Ada, Michigan

Full Job Description
Our internship program is an excellent way for you to gain experience, work with amazing people and complement your studies as you set the course for your future. The program lasts for 6 months beginning January and ending in June/July. The Engineering team under Shared Marketing and Innovation is a fast-paced and flexible team. The team culture isn’t just about one kind of person. So many individuals make up who we are, making us that much more unique. It’s what sets us apart, the dynamic, diverse and collaborative environment.

About us, but we’ll be brief

Experian is the world’s leading global information services company, unlocking the power of data to create more opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We are thrilled to share that FORTUNE has named Experian one of the 100 Best Companies to work for. In addition, for the last five years we’ve been named in the 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine.

What you’ll be doing

The Engineering team is seeking a motivated software-oriented intern who is ready to apply their love of software development to the release and communication management. We are looking for a motivated individual who can learn the craft of release management, which is a transferable skill to many professions. We are a mighty team embedded within the Marketing, Creative and Infrastructure teams. You will enjoy learning about the process of software development end to end.

We will pair you with seasoned managers, marketing owners and engineers who are practitioners of the Scaled Agile Framework and who work closely with software developers. You will support the program and release management duties of multiple development areas. You will have a chance to see the execution of releases into market, and get experience planning for the next release. You will work with many roles across the development lifecycle (such as product owner, software engineer, tester, scrum master)

What your background looks like

Must be enrolled in a BS/MS degree program in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing, Computer Science or related field
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Positive attitude and willingness to learn
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills

Perks

During this pandemic, all Experian employees are working remotely. Once it’s safe to do so, we’ll slowly return to our offices however we are in no rush to do this. The safety of our employees is of utmost importance
Flexible work schedule and relaxed dress code

EOE including Disability/Veteran

Full Job Description
Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

This is your chance to contribute to the tools and technologies unpinning Azure's accelerated computing platform. Our team's innovative solutions are used to build and optimize the hardware accelerators that power some of Microsoft’s most important and strategic projects in the cloud. Our work spans the stack from silicon to solutions, and across domains including deep learning, storage, and networking. Our team's building blocks are used by a fast-growing number of Microsoft engineering groups and customers to make large intelligent systems feasible, efficient, performant, and cost-effective. This is your chance to work on the future of computing.

Responsibilities

Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world’s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer

Additional Responsibilities
Develop prototype FPGA accelerators to demonstrate the feasibility of hardware acceleration of cloud workloads
Implement improvements to internal tools used in the development of hardware accelerators

Qualifications

In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must have 2 years of experience with FPGA and/or ASIC development
Must have 2 years experience with C/C++ programming
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship

Preferred Qualifications
Substantial time spent developing a compiler
Prior experience implementing FPGA accelerators

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Full Job Description

Company Overview

Final Drill is an all-in-one coaching platform built to create a safe, easy, and reliable online community where coaches can use several tools to continue to build upon and grow their coaching services. Athletes of all ages can join the community to connect with experienced coaches in their area who can help improve their athletic performance and skills.

We are a new startup and we're currently looking for a Web Development Intern to join our team. We are looking for an outstanding Web Developer to be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of our website. Web developer responsibilities include building our website from concept all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layout and function.

This is a fully remote-based part-time position with the flexibility to work from wherever you'd like as long as you have internet and phone access. We are happy to work around your schedule whether it's for school, another job, or personal reasons (we believe in work-life balance), but are looking for someone you can commit 10 - 20 hours a week in this role. This is an unpaid internship.

At Final Drill we believe in self-development and continuous learning.

Responsibilities

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
  • Create website layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices
  • Integrate data from various back-end services and databases
  • Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
  • Create and maintain software documentation
  • Be responsible for maintaining, expanding, and scaling our site
  • Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities
  • Cooperate with Marketing team to match visual design intent

Skills

  • Proven working experience in web programming and mobile app development
  • Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS
  • Familiarity with at least one of the following programming languages: React, PHP, ASP.NET, Javascript or Ruby on Rails
  • A solid understanding of how web applications work including security, session management, and best development practices
  • Adequate knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
  • Hands-on experience with network diagnostics, network analytics tools
  • Basic knowledge of Search Engine Optimization process
  • Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem solving skills
  • Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen
  • Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies and techniques.
  • BS in computer science or a related field preferred

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $0.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Full Job Description
At Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), we don't just believe in the power of technology, we believe in the power of people when technology works for them. We believe in applying new thinking and ideas to improve the way our customers live and work.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise's systems and software engineers develop solutions using the latest technologies to Make IT Simple for our customer base. HPE is more than an hardware company, we are a leading software development organization with a myriad of products ranging from an enterprise website getting millions of page views a week to a predictive analytics solution which can warn a customer of an issue before it happens. We're currently looking for hands-on, technically curious university students that want to grow their abilities as software engineers in a large-scale, worldwide development team.

Responsibilities:
You will be based in HPEs Fort Collins, CO site and will work on a specific project within an existing Agile, software engineering project team to solve problems within that team's focus.

You will need to be customer focused and will be given the time and assistance to learn in-depth about our software development practices and the latest tools used for software development and front-end technology. At least one senior developer will mentor you on your way but you will be welcomed within the entire team. Our Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) based teams include Scrum and Kanban methodologies depending on the team so at least a basic understanding of this environment is encouraged.

As a system/software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to HPEs needs with opportunities to gain experience across a broad range of cutting edge technologies. You will need to be enthusiastic and versatile to take on new problems across the full stack of of software engineering challenges. You will need to communicate effectively and be motivated to achieve results as part of your Agile team.

Relevant Skills:
Programming Languages: Java, Java Script, Python

Infrastructure/Operating Systems/Virtualization: Windows, Linux, Docker, Swarm, Spring, Spring Boot, Kafka, Ansible

Development Tools: GitHub, Jenkins, Selenium, FitNesse, JUnit, JUnit Params, Eclipse

Education/Requirements:
Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems major

Strong verbal and written communication

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to work well in teams

Strong work ethic and attention to detail

Hewlett Packard Enterprise Values:
Partnership first: We believe in the power of collaboration - building long term relationships with our customers, our partners and each other

Bias for action: We never sit still - we take advantage of every opportunity

Innovators at heart: We are driven to innovate - creating both practical and breakthrough advancements

HPE is an EOE / Female / Minority / Individual with Disabilities / Protected Veteran Status

What do we offer?

Extensive social benefits, flexible working hours, a competitive salary and shared values, make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers. At HPE our goal is to provide equal opportunities, work-life balance, and constantly evolving career opportunities.

If you are looking for challenges in a pleasant and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers

You can also find us on:
https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers

https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers

Full Job Description
Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) advances the way people live and work. We bring together curious minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world.

Joining HPE in an early career role is an excellent opportunity for a self-motivated, proactive individual to grow with us and help us drive our continued success globally. We are one of the largest technology companies in the world, operating in over 150 countries and market leading in several industries. We believe in partnership, innovation and taking action – our culture is what defines us as a company: how we act, how we treat others, and how we conduct business. In addition to working alongside great colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities.

You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We even have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

Why Aruba?

At Aruba, a Hewlett Packard Enterprise company, we believe that the most dynamic customer experiences happen at the Edge.

But where exactly is the Edge? It could be a workplace, a hospital, a school, or even a remote worker’s home. In these environments, data is generated by users, devices, and things. Organizations that successfully harness that data—by analyzing and acting on it in real time—can reveal valuable insights and deliver new services. More than that, they can delight their customers or produce better outcomes.

Our mission is to deliver innovative solutions that harness data at the Edge to drive powerful business outcomes.

We are always customer first, customer last.

We don’t develop technology for technology’s sake—everything we do starts and ends with our customers.

We are unconventional and innovative.

We have never been a traditional networking company; since the beginning we had to change the rules to survive. This is reflected in everything we do.

We are the biggest small company.

Over the years, we’ve maintained our core value of being the biggest, small company—treating our customers and employees like family while remaining nimble and ahead of market shifts.

About the Position

As an Aruba Web Developer, your primary responsibilities will be to assist in the design and development of new websites and webpages and microsites, operating within brand style guidelines and coding standards and perform maintenance and enhancements to existing websites, microsites, mobile sites and email campaigns.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Assist in the development of new websites and webpages and microsites, operating within brand style guidelines and coding standards.
Perform maintenance and enhancements to existing websites and microsites.
Assist in the development of functional specifications.
Produce deliverables related to assigned project(s); assist in post-implementation support and enhancements.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Education and Experience Required:
Must be currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent
Typically, 1-2 years of experience, and/or portfolio of recent work

Desired Skills and Experience

Cross-browser HTML/CSS knowledge, preferably HTML5/CSS3
Understanding of responsive design
Basic understanding of PHP and MySQL
Working experience/understanding of Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar reporting platforms
Working experience/knowledge of JavaScript/jQuery and WordPress CMS
Ability to manage time and workload. Understand when/how to reach out to peers, managers and other functions for assistance or guidance
You can function independently and work well within a team
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to effectively communicate plans, proposals, and results

What we can offer you:
Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth.

If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers.

Join us and make your mark!

Find out more about us and follow us on:
https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers
https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers

HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

You can also apply by https://careers.arubanetworks.com/jobs/all

TriNet is a leading provider of comprehensive human resources solutions for small to midsize businesses (SMBs). We enhance business productivity by enabling our clients to outsource their HR function to one strategic partner and allowing them to focus on operating and growing their core businesses. Our full-service HR solutions include features such as payroll processing, human capital consulting, employment law compliance and employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans and workers’ compensation insurance.

TriNet has a nationwide presence and an experienced executive team. Our stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol TNET. Description

Redko is a technology AI services company dedicated to building data/tech based solutions for businesses. Part Time IT Help Desk Technician

A1 Self Storage is currently seeking a part-time IT Help Desk Intern to work with our Director of Information Technology at our main office located in Mission Valley, San Diego, near San Diego State University. The IT Help Desk Technician will provide technical assistance to the company users by answering users’ questions, assisting users by troubleshooting problems with computer hardware or software and general technical support.

This is a part time paid internship. Hours will range from 16 to 20 per week. The ideal candidate must have a solid foundation in Information Technology and currently working on a computer science degree.

A-1 Self Storage currently owns and operates 48 self storage facilities throughout California. A-1 Self Storage is a 60 year old family owned company headquartered in San Diego and is one of California's premier self storage companies.

Duties and responsibilities:

  • Installing and configuring desktop hardware, software, systems, networks, printers and scanners
  • Monitoring and maintaining incoming service requests and responding in a timely manner
  • Interview users to determine the scope of the issue or need
  • Perform regular maintenance on computer systems
  • Providing technical support across the company (this may be in person or over the phone)
  • Setting up accounts for new users
  • Repairing and replacing equipment as necessary
  • Testing new technology
  • Support and troubleshoot telephone system issues
  • Maintain assets inventory
  • Maintain Active Directory

Required Skills/Abilities:

  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Capable of setting up new user’s desktops
  • Ability to prioritize technical support needs
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
  • Professional and pleasant telephone manner.
  • Ability to explain technical issues to technical and nontechnical employees and customers.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn an array of computer hardware and software.

Physical Requirements:

  • Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

Applicant Notice About Your Personal Information

Overview

This Notice explains your rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (“CCPA”) (Cal. Civ. Code § 1798.100 et seq.) and helps you understand how Caster Properties, Inc. d/b/a A-1 Storage (“A-1”) collects, stores, uses, shares, and secures your personal information in compliance with the CCPA. In this Notice, the terms “company,” ”us,” “we,” and “our” refer to A-1 and its affiliates and subsidiaries.

Who This Notice Applies To

The CCPA provides certain rights to job applicants (“applicant” or “you”). Additionally, the CCPA protects your emergency contact’s personal information you provide to A-1.

What We Collect and Why

As further described in the table below, the company collects information that identifies, relates to, describes, is reasonably capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with applicants (“Personal Information”). Personal Information does not include publicly available information from government records, deidentified information, or aggregated information.

The following chart details the purposes for which we collected Personal Information in the last twelve (12) months, and the categories of information we collected for each purpose. We will not collect additional categories of Personal Information without first updating applicant disclosures.

Personal Information A-1 Collected

Recruiting and Hiring

Personal identifiers, including name, address, phone number, and email

Characteristics of protected classifications under California or federal law

Professional or employment-related information, including employment history

Education information, including education history

Government Reporting

Characteristics of protected classifications under California or federal law

Where We Get Your Personal Information From

We collect your Personal Information from the following sources:

You: Primarily, we collect Personal Information directly from you in the application process.

Third parties: When we collect your Personal Information from third parties, such as job seeking websites, it is because you have provided consent either to us or to the third party. To the extent you use third-party websites, the sites may be governed by separate terms of use and privacy policies, which are not under our control and are not subject to this Notice. Please contact the third parties for questions regarding their privacy practices, as well as to exercise your rights.

When We Share Your Personal Information

A-1 does not and will not sell your Personal Information to third parties. A-1 may disclose your Personal Information to businesses and service providers in connection with processing your application. For example, A-1 may share your personal information with companies providing us background check services and information requested.

Rights To Request Under CCPA Effective January 1, 2021

You do not currently have the right to make requests under CCPA. Effective January 1, 2021, you may have the right to make requests about your Personal Information. A-1 will update applicant disclosures if/when additional rights become available.

How We Retain Your Personal Information

To the extent permitted by applicable law, A-1 will retain your Personal Information only for as long as the company believes it is necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, including for the purpose of meeting any legal, accounting, or other reporting requirements or obligations.

How You Are Protected Against Discrimination

A-1 will not unlawfully discriminate against you for exercising any of your rights under the CCPA. This commitment applies to all persons involved in A-1 operations and prohibits discrimination by any employee of A-1.

Disclaimer

Nothing in this Notice restricts A-1’s ability to:

Comply with federal, state, or local laws;

Comply with a civil, criminal, or regulatory inquiry, investigation, subpoena, or summons by federal, state, or local authorities;

Cooperate with law enforcement agencies concerning conduct or activity that the business, service provider, or third party reasonably and in good faith believes may violate federal, state, or local law; or

Exercise or defend legal claims.

Changes to this Notice

This Notice is reviewed and updated annually to ensure it accurately reflects our practices and procedures.

Resolving Concerns and How to Contact Us

If you have questions or concerns regarding this Notice or the handling of your Personal Information, please call 619-287-8873, Human Resources.

Knowledge and experience of performance/scalability/stress testing methodologies a plus

Howmet Aerospace looking for an Information Technology Intern to join our Howmet Wheel and Transportation Products (HWS) business unit in Cleveland, OH. Howmet (NYSE: HWM) creates breakthrough products that shape industries. HPE is looking for a motivated and creative computer science and/or electrical engineering student to work as a summer intern in the HPE Storage Networking team. They will spend the summer assisting engineers with the setup and configuration of released and unreleased commercial servers, networking gear, and storage array equipment. Poshmark is seeking Data Analytics Interns for Summer 2021. We are a rapidly growing multi-platform social fashion marketplace and working on interesting data science problems to improve user experiences. The role will be dynamic and varied, requiring a versatile self-starter willing to dive in to multiple initiatives. Over the next 10 weeks the intern can expect to become deeply involved in exploring and implementing analytics solutions that may run in production.

Our goal is to give the intern exposure to a range of data analysis/data science techniques and current big data technologies, through the experience of applying them to the multi-platform social marketplace dynamics. This role will provide an excellent opportunity to implement solutions that may run in production, at scale.

What you'll potentially be working on:
Focus on data analytics and modeling problems aimed to grow & optimize performance in one of these areas: Growth, Marketplace Operations, Product, Community Service etc.

Sample problems:
Product engagement & conversion optimization, customer lifetime value modeling, spend & campaign optimization
Marketplace demand & supply analysis
New business opportunity & feasibility analysis
Applying a range of analytic approaches including clustering, segmentation and regression

What To Expect:
Exposure: Being a rapidly growing social fashion marketplace gives employees the opportunity to work in a Start-Up environment and focus on deeply interesting work that you wouldn't get to do anywhere else. Prepare to make a large scale impact in a short amount of time.

Mentorship: Look forward to one-on-one time with dedicated managers and mentors to facilitate your growth throughout the summer internship experience.
Have fun: Virtual team events

What we're looking for:
Currently enrolled in an MS or PhD program in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Math, Statistics or a related field
Intermediate to advanced SQL coding skills. Working level skills in Python and/or R. Need to be able to pull your own big volume data, process it and create visualizations and reports.
Sound understanding of applied math topics such as probability and statistics, linear algebra, hypotheses testing and basic optimization techniques.
Working knowledge of algorithms, machine learning, data mining, statistics, applied mathematics or similar field.
Strong communication and collaboration skills; Being a team player is a must
Passion for consumer experience, a desire to go into uncharted territory with bold new ideas, and a willingness to go the last mile on execution

About Us:
Headquartered in beautiful Santa Barbara, HG Insights is the global leader in technology intelligence. HG Insights uses advanced data science methodologies to help the world's largest technology firms and the fastest growing companies accelerate their sales, marketing, and strategy efforts.

We offer a competitive salary, 401K, growth potential, great benefits, and a casual yet professional environment. Get your sweat on at one of our fitness classes or go for a run along the beach which is two blocks away. You can find employees riding bikes to lunch in the funk zone or hanging out in one of our collaboration spaces. We are passionate about our jobs with a get-it-done attitude, yet we don't take ourselves too seriously. While we work very hard, we also enjoy all that the Santa Barbara coast has to offer.

What You'll Do:
HG Insights is experiencing significant growth and in need of a Data Analyst Intern to work directly with our customers on their utilization of our data solutions. This role will challenge you to think creatively and ask questions about data leading to better solutions for our customers and enhancements to our internal processes that create the data. We're looking for someone who is passionate about data and can analyze and translate technical concepts to a sales and marketing audience.

This is an excellent opportunity for a recent grad or rising junior or senior college student to gain hands-on experience with all facets of Data in a supportive small business environment.

This is a paid internship opportunity for someone who wants 'on the job' experience and/or a future career as a Data Analyst and can ideally make a commitment of at least three months. Our Data Analyst Intern would be required to work two- three days per week, with flexible scheduling for current students to help work around academic commitments. Come work in our fast-paced, yet super supportive environment where all ideas are welcome!

What You'll Be Responsible For:
Perform triage, root cause analysis, and corrections to data issues reported by customers or exception reports.
Support the sales and Customer Success teams' data requests.
Explain best practices associated with HG Insights points to customers via Email and phone.
Prep and Deliver data to customers.
Become a resident expert on HG Insights's data sets, products, and markets - including Big Data, Data-as-a-Service, Predictive and Analytical Markets.
Explore additional ways in which HG can activate data sets for customers.

What You'll Need:
SQL Experience
Proficient in Excel - Vlookups, Pivot Tables
Experience with a BI tool like Tableau desired
Excellent listener and problem solver capable of recommending solutions to customer requests and technical issues.
0 to 3 years professional experience.
Completed or working towards a BA/BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related technical field.

Due to Covid-19, We've transitioned to a work-from-home model and we're continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. Normally, you'll be working in Santa Barbara two blocks from the beach!

HG Insights Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer

position: Research Intern - Global Health Data Science
description:
Full Job Description
Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

There has never been a more exciting time to be working in health and life sciences at Microsoft. Our investments across our organization in research and incubation, world-class talent, and strategic partnerships reflect our CEO Satya Nadella’s vision that many of the next health breakthroughs will come from health and life sciences organizations working in partnership with companies like Microsoft.

As a research intern in our Microsoft Health Next R&D group, you will have the unique opportunity to explore high-impact research careers at Microsoft as part of a network of world-class research and incubation efforts led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve the world’s most pressing problems.

Our Health Futures team, an interdisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and clinicians focused on developing next generation methods and tools for health and life sciences, is looking for a research intern who will research new methods and tools to help researchers and scientists, especially in low resource settings, leverage multimodal data sets to improve health outcomes. Specifically, we are looking for candidates that are interested in building algorithms to ingest and analyze multifactorial health data and improving utility of these data sets for decision makers.

#msfthealthcare #healthfutures #globalhealth #datascience

Responsibilities

Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world’s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

The research intern will collaborate with both internal Microsoft engineers and scientists and external stakeholders such as non-profits, academia, pharma to:

Build models and algorithms for multimodal health data mining.
Handle machine learning training problems that utilize real-world raw health and non-health data (e.g., structured and unstructured EMR, population health, epidemiology, genomics / immunomics, geographic data, etc.)
Conduct experiments and deliver prototypes for real-world impact.
Propose novel solutions to unsolved research and engineering problems
Qualifications

In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related STEM field.
Must have 1 year of experience with applied data mining, applied statistics, or a related STEM field.
Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship
Preferred Qualifications
Hands-on experience with multimodal health data sets.
Proficiency in Python or any other coding language
Experience with deep learning platforms PyTorch, Tensor Flow, CNTK.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
rack record of scientific publications (conference abstracts and/or paper)

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Artificial intelligence/machine learning

Python

Location:

Full Job Description
Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Special Projects at Microsoft Research is offering a research internship with a focus on modeling future computational systems based on neurological systems (including using data from connectome, FMRI, EEG, and microscopy) applying modern machine learning and graph theoretic methods toward building interactive systems using neurological modeling/feedback. This intern will join a team of applied statisticians, computer scientists, and neuroscience collaborators who research the brain and complex HCI systems.

Responsibilities

Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world’s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Qualifications

In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a research master’s degree program or PhD program in Mathematics, Neuroscience, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related STEM fiel

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship

Preferred Qualifications

Expertise in research in mathematics, neuroscience, statistics, computer science or a related field

Expertise in analyzing dynamic graph data or neurological data

Expertise in embeddings of graphs

Excellent research collaboration skills

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

The Urban Innovation group at Microsoft Research pursues state of the art science and technology development for urbanization. Lines of research focus on climate change and mitigating the environmental impact of our increasingly urban world, ensuring equitable economic growth, social and environmental justice, and building strong, healthy communities.

With more than 2 billion additional urban residents projected by 2050, humanity is rapidly becoming increasingly densely populated. Simultaneously, through the internet, mobile devices, and sensors and wearables, data and technology play an increasingly important and complex role in nearly every aspect of modern urban life, influencing communication, privacy and information exposure, mobility and transportation, environmental impact, economic equality and opportunity, and even the food we eat.

With backgrounds in computer science, social sciences, engineering, biology, chemistry, and design, researchers on the Urban Innovation team thus bring a multidisciplinary approach to leverage these trends to understand sociotechnical systems in urban environments and help build the future of technology in the service of society.

The Urban Innovation team seeks Research Interns in computer science, engineering, design, and social, health, and environmental science to help advance this agenda.

position: Hewlett Packard Labs -- Artificial Intelligence Lab Research Associate (Intern)
description:
Full Job Description
Hewlett Packard Enterprise advances the way people live and work. We bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world. At HPE we believe in bold moves, the power of “Yes we can”, and being a force for good. Our work thrives on differences, fueling creativity to give our customers all they deserve. But our work is far from over. In fact, we continuously push for better. We empower our team members to make an impact on our business and in the world while fostering a culture that is unconditionally inclusive. Whether you’re looking for an internship or to start your professional career, at HPE you’ll be in a position to create and collaborate on projects that challenge and inspire you.

HPE Labs are committed to the fast and seamless transfer of advanced technologies into next generation products and solutions; enabling the delivery of advanced Hybrid IT and IoT solutions for our customers.

We are currently seeking highly qualified, self-motivated interns to accelerate research towards new applications, core methodologies and technologies in Artificial Intelligence at Hewlett Packard Labs.

Hewlett Packard Labs is an international research organization with its headquarters and largest facility located in Milpitas, California. As the central research organization for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), Hewlett Packard Labs' purpose is to deliver breakthrough technologies and technology advancements that provide a competitive advantage for the company, by investing in fundamental science and technology in areas of interest to HPE and getting the resulting technologies ready for adoption into new and existing markets.

The Artificial Intelligence Lab research group focus on researching and developing technologies, architectures and software to develop cutting edge solutions in key areas of Deep Learning and Machine Learning, including Reinforcement Learning and Natural Language Processing. This is a unique opportunity to work at a start-up pace within a big company. We are looking for an entrepreneurial mind-set, and a deep passion to take a ML problem and conduct research and come up with a solution with a fast turnaround time. You will have an opportunity to work with Machine Learning experts who have made multiple successful products and will get guidance and coaching in different areas including software engineering, hardware optimizations, data pipelining, and innovations from latest AI research to bring hardened Deep Learning solutions to the real world.

This is a new and growing team at HPE in which you will be building the software, and applications for Neural Network and Machine Learning. It will also involve working with system programming, Deep Learning frameworks and models, GPU acceleration, Model optimization, real-time streaming data, distributed computing, and deployment.

We are seeking highly qualified candidates to come join one of our research teams as an intern, with the possibility of longer-term co-innovation and collaboration. We are particularly interested in individuals with a background in computer systems, machine learning, deep learning, and statistics, with a good understanding of the current state of the art, major trends and opportunities, and a demonstrated track record in making things real in innovative ways. The ideal candidate combines this interest with a broad, entrepreneurial interest in creating the next generation of HPE’s products and technologies.

We expect all our researchers (including interns and post-docs) to provide thought leadership and technical influence both internally and externally to HPE, as well as take innovative ideas and make them real – contributing along the full range from initial novel ideas to design, development, implementation, evaluation, and technology transfer. The ideal candidate can thrive in an applied research environment, balancing significant technical and scientific contributions with the ability to bring such contributions to practice through innovative solutions that address the needs of our customers and partners. We expect the successful candidate to collaborate with HP Labs research teams as well as with external partners, and to work in alignment with HPE's broader innovation community. Excellent software systems building skills are a significant plus.

Education and Experience:
Pursuing or recently completed PhD degree (or other degree with significant research and innovation experience) in a relevant discipline (e.g. machine learning, computer science, electrical engineering, math, statistics, etc.)

0-2 years relevant experience

Track record of world-class innovative contributions and ideas in machine learning.

Experience with innovative solution development, such as developing proofs-of-concept, first-of-a-kind solutions, and/or technology transfer.

Technical Skills:
Experience in deep learning research

Experience in developing deep learning software with high proficiency in data structures and algorithms.

Strong programming skills and experience with Python, C/C++, and preferably Java

Software development experience in Deep Learning, GPU acceleration, and Model Optimization.

Experience in Deep Learning and Machine Learning frameworks and models like Tensorflow, PyTorch - required

Experience in system software, GPU acceleration, DL model execution and performance optimization - desired

Experience in Neural Network architectures for Reinforcement Learning and natural language processing - desired

Experience with multi-threaded programming, parallel processing, OOD, OOP and distributed programming

Experience in Python Web Frameworks – Django, Flask - a plus

Self-motivated, pro-active, with leadership qualities

Ability to work with ambiguity

Demonstrated effective communication and collaboration skills

Demonstrated ability to generate, frame, and carry out leadership research as shown, for example, by papers published in top-tier conferences or journals.

Join us and make your mark!

We offer:
  • A competitive salary and extensive social benefits
  • Diverse and dynamic work environment
  • Work-life balance and support for career development
  • An amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?
Then let’s stay connected!
https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers

https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers

HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

position: MobilizeGreen Special Uses Resource Assistant Internships with the US Forest Service
description:
Full Job Description
Join Us. Do work that matters!

MobilizeGreen is a national nonprofit committed to jumpstarting green careers for diverse youth and recent graduates, while advancing environmental equity in communities across the country. We are specifically searching for applicants from diverse backgrounds looking to enter or continue their work in the outdoor sector!

Have you always wanted to work in conservation? Looking for new opportunities or to change direction? Search no further, we want you!

MobilizeGreen is partnering with the Forest Service to fill multiple special uses positions! These positions will provide the RA with a career-oriented introduction to the background, philosophy, concepts, and scope of the Forest Service through direct work with a number of different specialists. The RA will also gain a practical understanding of the policies of special uses administration and the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). RA assignments will be project-oriented and include all lands and recreation special uses including utilities, infrastructure, recreation events, and outfitter-guides. The RA will provide as-needed assistance to the recreation program by processing recreation fees, and supporting the volunteer program.

Becoming a Resource Assistant is the career focused move you have been waiting for, and will help you diversify your resume and gain the work experience you've always wanted.

Please apply today!

It gets better!

By applying for this position, you will be entered into a pool of candidates for over 40 similar positions, eliminating the need to apply to multiple resource assistant positions. We work hard to match candidates with ideal positions in National Forests across the country!

MobilizeGreen is a national nonprofit committed to jumpstarting green careers for diverse youth and recent graduates, while advancing environmental equity in communities across the country. We are currently recruiting for several special uses positions!

MobilizeGreen is a national nonprofit committed to jumpstarting green careers for diverse youth and recent graduates, while advancing environmental equity in communities across the country. We are currently recruiting for several Special Uses positions.

In partnership with the USDA Forest Service, MobilizeGreen offers internship opportunities for college students (graduating before April 12, 2021), graduate students, and recent graduates. The Resource Assistants Program (RAP) provides flexible internship placements based in National Forests across the US for those interested in Forest Service careers. Resource Assistants work under the mentorship and coaching of Forest Service staff to complete mission-critical work while developing leadership, critical thinking, and strategic communication skills. The RAP was designed for emerging professionals to launch their natural and cultural resources careers.

Each MobilizeGreen Resource Assistant starts their journey with a weeklong orientation, where they will meet other RAs and Forest Service staff from across the country and engage in skill building and career development activities. Once an RA arrives at their host site, they are supervised and mentored by a variety of Forest Service staff, engaging with experts from business, conservation, and science backgrounds, and learning more about careers as they work on vital projects within the Forest Service. Upon completion of the program, RAs receive a 2-year direct hiring certificate with the Forest Service, keeping the door open for exciting career opportunities with their host site, or with any of the 154 national forests across the country. MobilizeGreen will enhance your career opportunities, introduce you to key leaders in the natural resource field, and engage you on your career journey to a job with the Forest Service.

Position Title: Special Uses Resource Assistant (RA)

Position Location: Ozark St. Francis National Forest

Position Code: R2.MED.SPU

Position Abstract: The RA will administer the lands and recreation special uses program on the Laramie Ranger District of the Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest. This position will provide the RA with a career-oriented introduction to the background, philosophy, concepts, and scope of the Forest Service through direct work with a number of different specialists. The RA will also gain a practical understanding of the policies of special uses administration and the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). RA assignments will be project-oriented and include all lands and recreation special uses including utilities, infrastructure, recreation events, and outfitter-guides. The RA will provide as-needed assistance to the recreation program by processing recreation fees, and supporting the volunteer program.

Education Qualifications: A bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, Natural Resource Management, or a related field is required.

Position Title: Special Uses Resource Assistant

Full Job Description
Want to work on a product that will change the world? We are a San Francisco based team building self-driving semi trucks. We have raised $117MM in total and are backed by Tiger Global Management ($70MM Series C) and Sequoia Capital ($30MM Series B). On a daily basis we move freight between LA and Phoenix using our purpose-built transfer hubs. This is an incredibly exciting time for autonomous driving and our team is looking to grow and invest in interns like yourself!

Embark’s self-driving vehicles produce terabytes of data every day. Our Data Visualization team specializes in products that let engineers explore and visualize that data from the comfort of their web browser. We do this by marrying the latest web technologies with novel methods of visualizing data. Our primary product is a data visualization platform that lets engineers explore truck behavior for trucks on the road, on recorded data, and with new self-driving code, all in an easy-to-use interface. Users can move around a 3D scene, plot arbitrary signals, and use a suite of custom modules for understanding the state of the truck.

Internships typically run for 4 months starting in May.

Graduating college/university by 2022 or earlier
Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD in CS, Engineering, or equivalent real-world experience
Experience working on high performance web applications
Experience writing in JavaScript or a similar language in a production environment
Proficiency in React or other popular web frameworks
Communication skills
Passion to work with others
Perks
Mentorship from our software architects and senior developers
Real world experience working across our entire stack, both on and off the vehicle
Team offsites, swag, and new friends

description:
Full Job Description
Type: Internship
Experience: PhD/Graduate Students

Who we are:
We are Dataminr. We are a mission-driven company committed to the power of AI, public data, and real-time information as a force for good in the world. Over the last decade, our team has established and refined the leading AI platform for real-time event and risk detection. We surface the earliest signals of unfolding events and emerging risks within an increasingly diverse and complex landscape of publicly available information, enabling more effective risk mitigation strategies, faster response, and better crisis management. Dataminr serves thousands of professionals in 70+ countries by delivering timely, relevant, and actionable alerts to public and private sector organizations around the world.

We've grown to over 500 talented employees across seven global offices and raised $392 million in funding in our most recent investment round. Our culture promotes cross-team interaction, work-life balance and the sharing of information and ideas because it enables us to do our best work together, make a meaningful contribution, and have fun. Join us and help the world manage risk in real time.

Who you are:
You're a Ph.D. candidate who has published in top tier conferences and are passionate about having a positive impact on the world. You are enthusiastic about working on some of the most challenging problems in AI, working in a highly collaborative environment and directly contributing to products while advancing the state of the art. You are very creative, can work independently, and are an excellent collaborator and communicator.

Responsibilities:
Perform research to advance the state of the art and solve specific problems at scale in one or more of the following areas: NLP, HCI, Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Complex Networks.
Work closely with a diverse, interdisciplinary team on a specific project to be completed during the internship.
Excel in placing a human-centered focus on the work (context, end-user impact, etc), finding solutions that work in practice and have significant impact.

Minimum qualifications:
Must be enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.
Ideal candidates will have had prior internship experience.
Outstanding publication record in the candidate's field of study (ACL, CVPR, CHI, WWW, RecSys, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to work independently, set up experiments and demonstrate progress through principled used of metrics.

Full Job Description
Here at ON Semiconductor we take great pride in our internship program and the efforts we take to provide students with hands-on industry experience. We provide competitive pay, medical benefits, various networking event opportunities, and flexible hours based on school schedule.

As a Test Engineer at ON Semiconductor, you are responsible for developing test programs that can quickly but completely test the latest semiconductor devices before they are shipped to a customer. Depending on the product family you are responsible for you may be responsible for programming multimillion dollar test systems using DSP based test programs to measure complex devices, or you may be trying to optimize a factory test system that tests 400 million diodes a week. Test engineers working with design teams have the challenge of preparing new test rigs before they even have a chip to test, whereas factory based test engineers try to optimize test times and test coverage for hundreds of different products across multiple types of equipment.

This opportunity will ask a student to perform the following job duties:

Support testing and validation of CMOS image sensor products.
Work closely with our internal teams on development, testing and troubleshooting CMOS image sensor products in wafer or packaged form.
Development of software tools to improve new product development.

Qualifications

In order to be considered for an internship, you must be a student of junior or senior standing currently enrolled in a B.S. or M.S. Electrical Engineering or Computer Science program.

Programming in high level languages such as C, C++ and/or Visual Basic
Good spoken and written English skills for communicating with team members from various domestic and international sites.
Ability to understand electrical test equipment (with training) in order to develop tests for CMOS imagers.
Familiarity with Git is a plus.
Test Driven Development is a plus.

ON Semiconductor operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.

Create and update documentation associated with test processes and test code (flowcharts, requirements documents, procedures, training materials)

Monitor test system and diagnostic tool usage to identify effectiveness and opportunities for improvement

Investigate and identify root cause of debug software failures, equipment failures, or missing/inaccurate data impacting quality, efficiency, or technical data analysis

Collaborate across functional areas to drive proactive test solutions

Full Job Description
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook's Enterprise Engineering team develops and maintains scalable products that power the enterprise. Enterprise Product Applied Research team is composed of applied quantitative and computational experts using machine learning, statistics and operations research to bring in step-level improvements in efficiency and scalability across the entire suite of enterprise products. As a member of Enterprise Engineering, you will play a key role in reimagining productivity by shipping transformative products that serve diverse aspects of the enterprise.

Build pragmatic, scalable, and statistically rigorous scientific solutions for large scale enterprise problems by leveraging or developing state of the art machine learning and optimization methodologies on top of Facebook's unparalleled data infrastructure
Work cross-functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models and deploy them at scale.
Build and maintain data driven machine learning models, optimization models, experiments and forecasting algorithms.
Apply excellent communication skills in order to develop cross-functional partnerships and spread scientific best practices
Be able to work both independently and collaboratively with other scientists, engineers, designers, UX researchers, and product managers to accomplish complex tasks that deliver demonstrable value to Facebook's Enterprise Products.
Think creatively, proactively, and futuristically to identify new opportunities that will grow the enterprise product’s long-term roadmap and bring productivity gains for the enterprise

Pursuing Ph.D. in quantitative field (e.g. computer science, engineering, operations research, electrical engineering, statistics, mathematics and related fields),
Graduate research experience solving analytical problems and building models using quantitative, statistical or machine learning approaches
Experience with machine learning, natural language understanding, computer vision, statistics or mathematical programming tools and techniques
Experience developing deep learning models
Experience performing data extraction, cleaning, analysis and presentation
Experience with at least one programming language (i.e. Python, R, Java, or C++)
Experience with scientific computing and analysis packages such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, dplyr, or ggplot2
Experience with machine learning libraries and packages such as PyTorch, Caffe2, TensorFlow, Keras or Theano
Experience with statistics methods such as forecasting, time series, hypothesis testing, classification, clustering or regression analysis
Ability to communicate scientific work in a clear and effective manner
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Full Job Description
At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 14,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

A typical branch office has one financial advisor who meets with clients face-to-face and one branch office administrator who enhances the team's ability to build deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis and Tempe provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. Edward Jones currently has more branch offices than any other financial services firm, and we continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.

Headquarters Summer Internship Program:
During the 10-week program, our interns gain applicable knowledge for their future careers, as they work in partnership with Edward Jones associates. Individualized mentorship is provided to each intern to ensure their success. This is a unique opportunity to gain experience and industry knowledge through summer project work within the Information Systems Division, while also developing professionally through networking with peers, mentors and senior leaders at our Corporate Headquarters.

Information Systems (IS) Division Overview:
You’ll push boundaries to deliver the technologies that power our business. Whether designing new applications or enhancing infrastructure, your work in Information Systems will have a meaningful impact for both our clients and the firm.

A culture of continuous learning and innovation, you’ll be empowered to bring new ideas forward and leverage emerging technologies as our business evolves. By building and evolving systems, creating industry-leading technology tools and implementing state-of-the-art security, you’ll discover better and more effective ways to support our branch teams and the clients they serve.

Position Overview:
Opportunities to perform meaningful work in a supportive hands-on learning environment exist in the following areas:
Business Software Development - placement may include experiences such as:
Developing, maintaining and implementing business applications
Leveraging industry-standard tools such as Linux, Eclipse, XCode, Jenkins, JUnit, Spring, Maven, Gradle and Sonar
Developing in technologies such as Java, Swift (iOS), JavaScript, HTML, Spring Boot, REST, Thymeleaf, Docker, Kubernetes, Bootstrap, SQL and JPA
Structuring complex data into relational and NoSQL databases such as Oracle, MongoDB, Hadoop and DB2
Quality Assurance - placement may include experiences such as:
Interacting with the business and development teams to understand their testing needs to define and manage the test automation process
Understanding of QA methodologies, life cycle and processes
Creating, executing and maintaining new automated test cases using Selenium and Java
Evolving more predictive and intelligent testing approaches based on automation and innovative testing products and solutions
Information Security - placement may include experiences such as:
Providing first level security monitoring and investigations to protect our systems from internal and external threats
Assisting with forensics analysis and fact gathering
Assisting with vulnerability assessments/scanning for specific applications, OS's, services, networks and servers and appliances, as required
Assisting with configuration and maintenance of information security tools (e.g. AV, SIEM, IPS, Firewalls, e-mail gateway protection, DLP, DBAM, NAC, Certificate Management, Encryption, Proxy technologies, Threat Intelligence, Case management, anti-malware, Network Security Monitoring, Anti-Phishing, etc.)
User Center Excellence - placement may include experiences such as:
Developing high fidelity mockups into fully functional Front-end
Writing clean, efficient and browser agnostic HTML5/CSS3/Javascript
Leveraging your experience with Front-end Frameworks such as React.js, Angular.js, etc.
Who Should Apply?

Students with:
A cumulative G.P.A. or 3.0 or above
Junior or Senior standing with an anticipated graduation date of December 2021 or May 2022
A preferred major for this opportunity, including, but not limited to:
Computer Science/Computer Engineering
Management/Information Systems
Other-related Technical Degrees

Candidates who:
Drive to succeed and have an interest in the financial services industry
Have excellent leadership, communication, teamwork and service skills
Demonstrate leadership in campus organizations and activities

Utilize critical thinking to challenge current processes and seek opportunities to improve
