Full Job Description
Position Description:
About Lenovo

Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation – to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!

Who You’ll Work With
At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/o¬ffice solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.
IDG (Intelligent Device Group) – The IDG at Lenovo houses our PC and Smart Devices. We combine investment in high-growth segments (workstations, gaming, visuals, thin and light devices) with new innovation in the smart device categories and continue to explore new opportunities across AR/VR, artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), security and as-a-service solutions.

About Our Team
Our team manages supply/demand and product operations for all commercial product offerings in Lenovo. We are responsible for managing short and long term forecasting, new product launch and transition and resolving supply/demand imbalances that frequently occur in a business. We are also in close association with other strategic partners in the industry to grow the commercial business. If you’ve ever wondered how a new product is planned and launched and how it replaces existing products in large company environments, how a company like Lenovo links up with other industry leaders to deliver the best products for our customers, and how a company leverages diversity to get these things done, this is the team for you. While learning how we do operations today it is also our opportunity to learn and apply new approaches and ideas only you can bring.

Half of our tightly knit team is here in the US in the NC Triangle Area and half in Beijing, China. We are a mix of very young and very seasoned professionals who love sharing our thoughts and approaches to come up with the best solutions for our customers and working with our strong strategic alliance partners in the industry. It is common for us to talk in the early morning or late evening, and to communicate using WeChat (for example) to share our personal joys and celebrations.
If you are looking for more than just an internship, this is a place for you to grow, develop and learn.

What You’ll Do
You will have the opportunity to connect what you have learned in your business and operations classes with real world experience…yes, you will finally get to co-create and present your ideas to business leaders in both the US and Asia and understand the nuances of different cultures approaches to operations business challenges. And you’ll be coached at every step.

This summer your primary job will be to do analysis of business data on ThinkPad notebooks. This is a highly profitable area for our company with quite a bit of visibility. What an awesome opportunity! If it sounds a little daunting, don’t worry, you will have a lot of support from our team as well as marketing and development and we will onboard you fully to make sure you have all the knowledge you need to be successful.

We’re interested in your ideas on how to present and sell solutions we create together across cultures and to both peers and executives.

As an intern we also want to ensure you have an opportunity to network across the organization this summer. You might not know exactly what you want to do when you graduate, but maybe we can help you discover new passions and areas of opportunity. Our interns meet at least four times in a small group roundtable with our Vice Presidents of Development, Marketing and Operations during their rotations and have the opportunity to both create and convey their approaches in our operations weekly worldwide segment dashboard meeting.

Position Requirements:
Basic Requirements:
  • Working toward a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related degree program
  • 3.5 Minimum GPA
  • Preferred Language skills: Spanish
  • You will be successful in this position if you are an Excel expert and love making spreadsheets
  • Basic data handling and query capability – you will learn this as you go, but familiarity ahead of time is a definite plus
  • Supply Chain terms for Supply and Demand, Forecasting and Order logic
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

We’re looking for motivated engineers who want to apply themselves to design and test advanced automation solutions using digital control systems. If you have an aptitude for programming and control system design, then this job is for you!

As an Automation Controls Intern, you will interface with project managers and clients to lead efforts for the development of advanced process control solutions in a variety of platforms, including Honeywell Experion. You’ll be expected to quickly adapt your engineering skills to solve complex process control solutions using modern programming environments, using both DCS (Distributed Control Systems) and SCADA (Supervisory Control &Data Acquisition) systems.

We expect you to have excellent communication skills, fast and accurate typing skills, and a very high level of proficiency with Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office. You absolutely must bring a teachable attitude to the job, be willing to do grunt work, show up on time to work efficiently and productively, and respectfully communicate in a professional work atmosphere.

This exciting opportunity will launch your professional career into the world of control systems, giving you a chance to work with industrial automation platforms in ways you’ve never dreamed possible. Visit us at https://www.idspower.com for more information.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Develop advanced control automation solutions using state-of-the art programming tools
  • Understand and translate automation code from a variety of programming languages, including Ladder Logic, Function Block Diagrams, and Sequential Function Charts.
  • Build and implement automation logic for equipment control, including permissives, interlocks, and batch operation sequencing.
  • Build and implement advanced analog control strategies, including PID, feedforward control, and many other complex control schemes.
  • Develop intricate HMI designs using graphical interface design tools.
  • Travel, as required, to ensure successful project execution.
  • Communicate appropriately in a professional team environment.

Required Skills, Education, and Experience:

  • Pursuing or completed Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or related degree.
  • Taken classes related to programming, process control, or automation systems.
  • Excellent computer, written and oral communication skills.
  • Must have desire, willingness, and ability to learn and solve challenging problems.
  • Self-motivated and able to complete assignments quickly and work productively in a professional business environment.
  • Reliable team player, working together in a team environment toward the highest degree of team and customer satisfaction.
  • Comprehensive understanding and experience working with Microsoft Word & Excel.
  • Basic understanding and experience in controls engineering, including understanding of process control strategies.

We're seeking Technical Writing Interns to join our diverse and highly technical team of engineers whose key role is to develop and maintain all user documentation for our product suite. Work on impactful and exciting technology that will be published in our product manuals

Full Job Description

FLAGDream is an education technology corporation founded by an elite team from top tech companies in Silicon Valley. Our mission is to help students join the world's leading companies, relying on our strong resources, networks, and mentor teams throughout Silicon Valley and Wall Street. FLAGDream provides students with career development, consulting, and vocational skill training services. We cover industry trends such in computer science, AI, finance, management consulting, business analysis, FMCG/CPG, culture/creative industries, and more. As a result, we send thousands of trainees to Silicon Valley and top companies in various industries around the world every year.

Job Summary:

We are looking for Marketing professionals to assist in developing FLAGDream’s promotional content. This role works with Marketing managers and Business Development manager to produce company-related content in order to achieve the goal of business development and increasing brand penetration in the markets we serve and emerging markets.

What You’ll Do:

  • Develop and create marketing materials according to brand guidelines, such as flyers, posters, banners, videos, etc.
  • Present the positive image of the brand and expand its brand influence in the education industry
  • Collect the hot-spot news and use this news to create company promotional articles
  • Conduct market and competition studies to identify new marketing and advertising opportunities
  • Assist Manager and perform other duties as assigned

What You’ll Have:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Positive attitude plus good teamwork
  • Strong market sensitivity
  • The ability to be creative
  • Strong organizational skills, knowledge, and experience

What You’ll need:

  • Bachelor’s or Masters in Marketing, Business, Management or related field
  • Fluent in both Chinese and English

What You‘ll obtain:

  • Build a high-level network
  • Exclusive FLAGDream events
  • Practical knowledge learning

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Pay: $0.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

  • Content creation: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

  • Mandarin (Required)

This Job Is:

  • A “Fair Chance” job (you or the employer follow Fair Chance hiring practices when performing background checks)
  • A good job for someone just entering the workforce or returning to the workforce with limited experience and education

Company's website:

  • https://en.flagdream.com/

Company's Facebook page:

  • https://www.facebook.com/FLAGDream

Work Remotely:

  • Yes, temporarily due to COVID-19

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process

Persons Eligible to Apply

To be eligible for the Summer Intern Program, an individual must have a minimum of 60 credit hours completed towards a

qualifying bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university by the posting date of the job.

ALL APPLICANTS MUST ATTACH RESUME AND TRANSCRIPT (OFFICIAL or UNOFFICIAL) TO BE CONSIDERED FOR

THIS POSITION!!!

ALL APPLICANTS MUST BE AVAILABLE TO START ON MONDAY, MAY 24, 2021 TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS

POSITION!!!

Background Check

The Inspection Service criminal background check is conducted using United States information resources only (e.g., FBI
fingerprint check, state and county checks). A criminal background check involves a 5-year inquiry for any location where

the individual has resided, worked or gone to school within the United States or its territories. As a result of this limitation,
the criminal background checks of individuals who have not resided in the United States or its territories for the preceding
5-years may not be considered complete. The Inspection Service may be able to process inquiries for U.S. Citizens only,
but only if their time spent out of the country was spent as: a trailing spouse or dependent of someone working for the U.S.
government (military or civilian), a missionary, a student attending school in a foreign country, a Peace Corps participant, or
as an employee of a U.S.-based employer/company. If the Inspection Service is unable to perform a complete background
check because of residency outside the United States, such individuals will be ineligible for Postal employment.

Functional Purpose

Analytics Interns will apply their knowledge and understanding of related principles and practices gained from their program

of study to support an assigned project. Project topics can range from data analytics, project management, and geospatial

analytics to code and model development.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Support assigned project(s) by applying relevant knowledge, practices and methodologies; collaborates with team to

analyze and define data requirements for the organization.

2. Develops an understanding of project assignment including goals, tasks, deadlines and key stakeholders. Uses standard

project management tools and techniques (e.g., Agile, Lean). Communicates updates and project developments as needed.

3. Develops project-related materials (e.g., pans, timelines) and supports project-related meetings and brainstorming

sessions. Assists in developing communications materials (e.g., business cases, status updates, reports, presentations) to

provide information to internal and external clients.

4. Collaborates with CIO groups and business units to analyze data and to identify opportunities and trends for improving

processes.

5. Collaborates with internal stakeholders in Operations to determine organizational priorities and increase efficiencies.

SUPERVISION

Manager of unit to which assigned.

The United States Postal Service has the following excellent and challenging employment opportunity for highly motivated
and innovative individuals. Successful candidates must demonstrate through a combination of education, training, and

experience the following requirements:
Requirements

1. Ability to coordinate work, maintain positive work relationships and interact with a team sufficient to complete assignments,

including communicating orally and in writing and completing tasks independently

2. Ability to attend to details sufficient to ensure accuracy and comprehensiveness of work.

3. EDUCATION REQUIREMENT: Applicants must be currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or graduate degree program studying
Data Science, Data Analytics, Geospatial Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Project Management, Information

Technology or another closely related field accredited by the U.S. Department of Education.

4. Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a succinct and organized manner; producing written materials, taking into

account proper audience, content, format, and grammar.

5. Ability to use Microsoft Office Suite (e.g., Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint,) sufficient to analyze data, create and format

reports, and create presentations.

6. Ability to acquire new knowledge and skills through on-the-job training and self-directed learning, including researching

information using various sources of information such as existing policies, processes, systems, databases and online

references, and using problem-solving techniques to identify root causes and develop solutions.

7. Ability to think critically to assess the current needs of the organization and develop solutions to grow revenue and/or cut

costs.

**This position requires a NACI clearance. This process can take up to 6 - 8 weeks from the date the offer letter is returned**

This is a two-step application process requiring you to create a profile and submit an application for the position for which you

are applying. You will receive two email confirmations:
A) An email confirming your profile is complete.

B) After submitting your application you will receive a second email confirming your application has been successfully

submitted.

ALL APPLICANTS MUST ATTACH RESUME AND TRANSCRIPT TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION!!!

For additional information, please contact us at universityrelations@usps.gov.

Qualified applicants must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screening to meet the U.S. Postal Service's

Qualified applicants must successfully pass a pre-employment drug screening to meet the U.S. Postal Service's requirement
to be drug free. Applicants must also be a U.S. citizen or have permanent resident alien status.

IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
Applications must be submitted by 11:59 p.m., Central Time, of the posting's closing date. Applicants claiming veterans'
preference must attach a copy of member copy 4 (only) of Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty (DD Form
214) or other proof of eligibility if claiming 10-point veterans' preference. The United States Postal Service (USPS) is an
equal opportunity employer. The USPS provides reasonable accommodation for any part of the application, interview, and/or
selection process, please make your request to the examiner, selecting official or local manager of Human Resources. This
request can also be made by someone on your behalf. Explain the nature of your limitations and the accommodation
needed. The decision on granting reasonable accommodation will be on a case-by-case basis.

SPECIAL NOTE: Current career Postal Service employees are ineligible to apply to this posting.

Full Job Description

We are looking for a qualified Application Developer to design and code functional programs and applications. You will work as part of a team and individually with little supervision.

A great Application Developer has excellent knowledge of at least one programming language. They must be familiar with a variety of operating systems and platforms. The ideal candidate will also have an analytical mindset and a keen eye for detail.

The goal is to write “clean” and flawless code to produce fully functional software applications according to requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Understand client requirements and how they translate in application features
  • Collaborate with a team of IT professionals to set specifications for new applications
  • Design creative prototypes according to specifications
  • Write high quality source code to program complete applications within deadlines
  • Perform unit and integration testing before launch
  • Conduct functional and non-functional testing
  • Troubleshoot and debug applications
  • Evaluate existing applications to reprogram, update and add new features
  • Develop technical documents and handbooks to accurately represent application design and code

Requirements

  • Proven experience as application developer
  • Experience in designing and building applications
  • Ability to program in at least one programming language such as C#, Java (J2EE) etc.
  • In-depth knowledge of programming for diverse operating systems and platforms using development tools
  • Excellent understanding of software design and programming principles.
  • A team player with excellent communication skills
  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving capability
  • Great attention to detail and time-management skills
  • BSc/BA in computer science or relevant field; MSc/MA will be appreciated
  • Certified application developer is a plus

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: $0.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We have moved all of our positions to work from home until further notice. We are not looking to have anyone in the office through the Spring semester.

Experience:

  • Xcode: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Swift: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Work Remotely:

  • Yes, always
